content.p: Find {{listing_prob}} using the listing method (sometimes called the set intersection method). You must show correct lists and a final answer.

outtro.p: The smallest nonzero multiple appearing in both lists simultaneously is {{listing_lcm}}, so {{listing_prob}} = {{listing_lcm}}

content.p: Find {{factorization_prob}} using the prime factorization method. You must show your factorizations before giving the final answer. You may leave your answer in factored form.

outtro.p: Multiplying together all prime factors of {{factorization_a}} and {{factorization_b}}, then removing the overlapping prime factors gives us {{factorization_mult_lcm}}, so {{factorization_prob}} = {{factorization_lcm}}
